page.title: List of video games notable for negative reception

revisions.rev:
<!--A note to editors: Before adding a game to the article, you should first visit this article's discussion page (click 'discussion' above). When you are adding a game, please provide credible sources, preferably those which consider it the "worst", or it will be removed from the list.-->
The [[video game]]s listed here have achieved notably negative reception from a variety of gaming publications, some of which have also labelled them as the '''worst video games ever made'''.
==1980s== ===''[[Custer's Revenge]]'' (Atari 2600)=== This 1982 [[Mystique (company)|Mystique]] game was controversial due to its objective: the apparent [[rape]] of a [[Indigenous peoples of the Americas|Native American]] woman.<ref name="GameSpy1"/> [[Atari]] received numerous complaints about the game, and responded by trying to sue the game's makers,<ref>{{cite book |title=Phoenix: The Fall & Rise of Videogames |last=Herman |first=Leonard |year=1997 |publisher= |location= |isbn= |page=88 |pages= |url= |accessdate=}}</ref> before the game was ultimately withdrawn from circulation.<ref>{{cite journal |last1=Talbot |first1=David |last2= |first2= |year=1983 |title=Pac-Man Kills Kids, Self: Video Horrors |journal=[[Mother Jones (magazine)|Mother Jones]] |volume= |issue=April |at=7 |pages= |url= |doi= }}</ref> The game was listed as the most shameful game of all time by [[GameSpy]],<ref name="GameSpy1">[http://archive.gamespy.com/top10/december02/shame/index4.shtml Top Ten Shameful Games]. [[GameSpy]]. Retrieved on May 29, 2008.</ref> as the third-worst game of all time by ''[[PC World (magazine)|PC World]]''<ref name="PCworld" /> and [[GameTrailers]] in 2006,<ref name="GameTrailers">[http://www.gametrailers.com/player/15147.html GT Countdown: Top Ten Best and Worst Games of All Time]. [[GameTrailers]]. Retrieved on May 25, 2008.</ref> and the ninth-worst game by [[Seanbaby]] in ''[[Electronic Gaming Monthly]]''.<ref name="Seanbaby">[[Seanbaby]]. [http://www.seanbaby.com/nes/egm09.htm EGM's Crapstavaganza: The Twenty Worst Games of All Time]. ''[[Electronic Gaming Monthly]]''. Retrieved on May 29, 2008.</ref>
===''[[E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial (video game)|E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial]]'' (Atari 2600)=== [[File:ET2600-Pit.gif|thumb|200px|''E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial'' received significant criticism for its poor quality graphics and redundant/confusing gameplay]]
Based on the popular [[E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial|Steven Spielberg film]], this 1982 [[Atari, Inc.]] adventure game was reputedly coded in just five weeks in order to be released during the [[1982 in video gaming|1982]] holiday season.<ref name="snopes">{{cite web|url=http://www.snopes.com/business/market/atari.asp|title=Five Million E.T. Pieces|date=2007-02-02|publisher=Snopes|accessdate=2009-02-12}}</ref> Despite selling 1.5 million copies,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.next-gen.biz/features/30-defining-moments-gaming|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20071216163006/http://www.next-gen.biz/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=6818&Itemid=2|archivedate=2007-12-16|publisher=[[Next Generation Magazine|Next-Gen.biz]]|date=Matt Matthews| title=The 30 defining moments in gaming|accessdate=2008-01-31|date=2007-08-13}}</ref> the game came nowhere near Atari's expectations as it ordered five million copies,<ref name="snopes"/> and a good deal of the sold games were sent back to the company because many consumers found the game to be unenjoyable.<ref name="snopes"/> Millions of these cartridges were reportedly [[Atari video game burial|buried in a landfill in New Mexico]] after they failed to sell.<ref name="GoHome">McQuiddy, M.E. (September 27, 1983). [http://atari.digital-madman.com/graphics/atari.gif City to Atari: 'E.T.' trash go home]. ''Alamogordo Daily News''. Retrieved on May 27, 2008.</ref><ref name="1UP-etcrash"/> ''E.T.'' is commonly cited as the catalyst for a [[North American video game crash of 1983|crash of the video game industry in 1983]], as Atari had hoped that [[brand loyalty]] would keep consumers buying their games regardless of quality.<ref name="1UP-etcrash">{{cite web| last = Parish| first = Jeremy| url = http://1up.com/do/feature?cId=3124081&did=1| title = The Most Important Games Ever Made: #13: E.T.| publisher = 1UP.com| accessdate = 2006-07-01}}</ref><ref name="GamePro-etcrash">[http://web.archive.org/web/20110607152658/http://www.gamepro.com/article/features/110028/the-52-most-important-video-games-of-all-time/ The 52 Most Important Video Games of All Time]. GamePro. Retrieved 2010-2-18.</ref> ''E.T.'' was listed as the worst game of all time by [[PC World (magazine)|''PC World'']] in 2006,<ref name="PCworld">Townsend, Emru (October 23, 2006). [http://www.pcworld.com/article/id,127579-page,2-c,games/article.html The 10 Worst Games of All Time]. [[PC World (magazine)|PC World]]. Retrieved on May 25, 2008.</ref> ''[[Electronic Gaming Monthly]]'',<ref name="EGM">[[Seanbaby]]. [http://www.seanbaby.com/nes/egm01.htm EGM's Crapstravaganza: The 20 Worst Games of All Time]. [[Electronic Gaming Monthly]]. Retrieved on May 25, 2008.</ref> and ''[[FHM]]''.<ref name="PBS">[http://www.pbs.org/kcts/videogamerevolution/history/best-n-worst.html The Video Game Revolution: Best and Worst Games of All Time]. [[Public Broadcasting Service|PBS]]. Retrieved on May 25, 2008.</ref> [[GameTrailers]] ranked it as the second worst movie game ever (losing only to [[Charlie's Angels (video game)|''Charlie's Angels'']]) by [[GameTrailers]] in 2007<ref name="gametrailers.com">http://www.gametrailers.com/player/21160.html. [[GameTrailers]]. Retrieved on August 10, 2008.</ref> and the second worst game of all time overall in 2006 (losing only to ''[[Superman 64]]'').<ref name="GameTrailers"/> Some considered it so bad that the [[Title screen (gaming)|title screen]] was the only good part of the game.<ref name="CG-et">{{cite web | last = Fragmaster| url = http://classicgaming.gamespy.com/View.php?view=GameMuseum.Detail&id=290| title = Game of the Week: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial| publisher = Classic Gaming| accessdate = 2006-06-29}}</ref> [[IGN]] called the negative reception for the game "the stuff of legend".<ref>(2009). [http://www.ign.com/top-25-consoles/2.html Top 24 Videogame Consoles of All Time], IGN.</ref> In 2007, GamePro named ''E.T.'' one of the 52 most important games of all time due to its roles in the 1983 video game crash and the downfall of the seemingly unstoppable Atari. It is the only game to make the list for having had a negative impact on the video game industry.<ref name="GamePro-etcrash"/>
===''[[Pac-Man (Atari 2600)|Pac-Man]]'' (Atari 2600)=== This 1982 [[Atari Inc.]] port of the popular arcade game ''[[Pac-Man]]'' was significantly altered from the original in order to meet the console's limitations. Some of these changes included simplified graphics, a modified maze layout, and "flickering" ghosts as a workaround for technical limitations (the game only rendered one ghost on screen per frame).<ref name="NG-40"/> [[Ed Logg]], a former lead designer at Atari, considered the development a rushed, "lousy" effort. Developer Tod Frye did not express regret over his part in ''Pac-Man''{{'}}s port and felt he made the best decisions he could at the time. However, Frye stated that he would have done things differently with a larger capacity ROM.<ref name="NG-40"/> Despite the changes, the port was a commercial success and sold over seven million copies.<ref name="NG-40">{{cite journal| journal = [[Next Generation Magazine]]| title = What the hell happened?| author = Staff| publisher = [[Future plc|Imagine Media]]| issue = 40| page = p. 41| month = April| year = 1998}}</ref> In 1998, ''[[Next Generation Magazine]]'' called it the "worst coin-op conversion of all time", and attributed the mass dissatisfaction to its poor quality.<ref name="NG-40"/> In 2006, [[IGN]] echoed similar statements and listed ''Pac-Man'' as the worst home console port of an arcade game ever;<ref name="IGN-Worst-Coinop">{{cite web| url = http://ds.ign.com/articles/715/715236p1.html| title = Top 10 Tuesday: Worst Coin-op Conversions| first = Craig| last = Harris| date = 2006-06-27| publisher = IGN| accessdate = 2009-07-15}}</ref> another IGN editor described it as a "disastrous port".<ref name="IGN-TopSellingAtari">{{cite web| url = http://retro.ign.com/articles/903/903024p1.html| title = Top 10 Best-Selling Atari 2600 Games| first = Levi| last = Buchanan| date = 2008-08-26| publisher = IGN| accessdate = 2009-07-15}}</ref>
==1990s== ===''[[Bubsy 3D]]'' (PS)=== ''Bubsy 3D'' is 1996 platform game by [[Sony Bend|Eidetic]] which [[GamesRadar]] called the video game equivalent to terrible films such as ''[[Plan 9 from Outer Space]]'' and ''[[Battlefield Earth (film)|Battlefield Earth]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Goulter|first=Tom|title=Gaming's would-be innovators|url=http://www.gamesradar.com/f/gamings-would-be-innovators/a-2009091695122763015|work=GamesRader|publisher=Future US, Inc|accessdate=2011-04-07}}</ref> [[GameTrailers]] named it the eighth worst video game ever made, calling it a "blatant rip-off of ''[[Super Mario 64]]''."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gametrailers.com/video/top-ten-gt-countdown/15147 |title=Top Ten Best and Worst Games of All Time |publisher=GameTrailers |date=2006-11-17 |accessdate=2011-04-07}}</ref> [[Seanbaby]] named it the 17th worst game of all time, criticizing its controls, the character's personality, and the graphical world, which "looks like it was built out of old milk cartons by a group of first graders from a country that had never seen milk cartons before."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.seanbaby.com/nes/egm17.htm |title=EGM's Crapstravaganza: The 20 Worst Games of All Time |accessdate=2011-04-07 |author=Seanbaby}}</ref>
===''[[Catfight (video game)|Catfight]]'' (PC)=== This 1996 women-only ''[[Mortal Kombat]]''-style fighting game by Phantom Card got widely panned and has a [[GameRankings]] score of only 8.67%.<ref name=catfight>[http://www.gamerankings.com/pc/196888-catfight/index.html Catfight for PC] ([[GameRankings]])</ref> Various reviewers gave it the lowest score possible, including 0/10 in ''[[Computer Games Magazine]]''<ref name=catfight /> and one star in ''[[Next Generation]]''. <ref>''[[Next Generation]]'' 22 (October 1996), p. 183</ref> At the time of its release in 1996, [[GameSpot]] called it "without a doubt, the worst [[Personal computer game|computer game]] ever released",<ref>[http://www.gamespot.com/pc/action/catfight/review.html Catfight Review] ([[GameSpot]])</ref> while ''[[The Daily Pennsylvanian]]'' called it the number one most [[sexism|sexist]] game ever created.<ref>[http://thedp.com/node/7927 Networking redefines the standards for PC gaming] (''[[The Daily Pennsylvanian]]'')</ref> In 2010, ''[[PC Gamer]]'' ranked "this low-resolution smut" as the #7 worst PC game of all time, citing its "insulting premise, dismal AI, [and] awful controls" and calling it "so bad, being caught masturbating to it would actually be less embarrassing than being caught playing it."<ref>[http://www.pcgamer.com/2010/09/30/the-15-worst-pc-games-of-all-time/2/ The 15 worst PC games of all time | PC Gamer]</ref>
===''[[CD-i games from The Legend of Zelda series|Link: The Faces of Evil / Zelda: The Wand of Gamelon]]'' (CD-i)=== As a result of canceled plans to release a [[CD-ROM]] add-on for the [[Super Nintendo Entertainment System]], [[Nintendo]] granted [[Philips]] licenses to use some of their major characters in games for their [[CD-i]] system. Philips would release three ''[[The Legend of Zelda (series)|The Legend of Zelda]]'' games for the system; ''Link: The Faces of Evil'', ''Zelda: The Wand of Gamelon'' and ''Zelda's Adventure'' {{emdash}} produced with limited involvement by Nintendo.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gametrailers.com/player/14537.html |title=The Legend of Zelda Retrospective Zelda Retrospective Part 3 |author=GameTrailers Staff |publisher=[[GameTrailers]] |date=2006-10-22 |accessdate=2008-04-07}}</ref> The first two games were developed in tandem by [[Animation Magic]], using the same game engine, and were released on the same day in 1993.<ref name="developer">{{cite web |url=http://www.hardcoregaming101.net/zeldacdi/zeldacdi.htm |title=Zelda: Wand of Gamelon / Link: Faces of Evil - Phillips CD-I (1993) |first=John |last=Szczepaniak |work=[http://www.hardcoregaming101.net Hardcore Gaming 101] |date=2008-01-01 |accessdate=2010-02-04}}</ref> These two games gained notoriety due to their barely functional controls, lackluster gameplay, and numerous bugs.<ref name="GameTrailers"/> Attention was also brought to their animated cutscenes, which were called "infamous" by [[IGN]],<ref>{{cite web|last=Drucker |first=Michael S. |url=http://dvd.ign.com/articles/655/655002p1.html |title=The Legend of Zelda: The Complete Animated Series - DVD Review at IGN |publisher=Dvd.ign.com |date=2005-09-30 |accessdate=2010-05-14}}</ref> while others called them "bizarre" and "an absolute joke".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.1up.com/do/feature?pager.offset=5&cId=3149883 |title=CDi: The Ugly Duckling |first=Danny |last=Cowan |publisher=[[1UP.com]] |date=2006-04-25 |accessdate=2008-04-07}}</ref> ''The Wand of Gamelon'' was ranked the #6 worst video game of all time by ''[[Electronic Gaming Monthly]]''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.seanbaby.com/nes/egm06.htm |title=EGM's Crapstravaganza: The 20 Worst Games of All Time |publisher=Seanbaby.com |date= |accessdate=2009-08-21}}</ref> and the #5 by [[GameTrailers]] in 2006.<ref name="GameTrailers"/>
===''[[Superman (1999 video game)|Superman]]'' (N64)=== This 1999 third-person action game by [[Titus Software]], based on ''[[Superman: The Animated Series]]'', was widely criticized for having unnecessarily repetitive, difficult, and confusing objectives, unnecessarily short time limits that left no margin for error, poor graphics and poor controls.<ref name="GameSpotSuper"/><ref name="IGN Super"/> As a result, critics were overwhelmingly negative in reviews; [[GameSpot]]'s Joe Fielder declared ''Superman'' the worst game he had ever played, adding that "it serves no purpose other than to firmly establish the bottom of the barrel."<ref name="GameSpotSuper">Fielder, Joe (June 8, 1999). [http://www.gamespot.com/n64/adventure/superman64/review.html Superman for Nintendo 64 Review]. [[GameSpot]]. Retrieved on May 25, 2008.</ref> Both [[IGN]]<ref name="IGN Super">Casamassina, Matt (June 2, 1999). [http://ign64.ign.com/articles/151/151957p1.html Superman Review]. [[IGN]]. Retrieved on May 25, 2008.</ref> and [[Game Revolution]] panned the game for its atrocious set-up, gameplay, and graphics.<ref name="GameRev">Leong, George. [http://www.gamerevolution.com/review/n64/superman Superman review for the N64]. [[Game Revolution]]. Retrieved on May 25, 2008.</ref> ''Superman'' was listed as the worst game of all time by GameTrailer] in 2006,<ref name="GameTrailers"/> the worst game on any Nintendo platform by ''[[Nintendo Power]]'' in 2006,<ref>{{cite news | title=Top 5 Worst Games Ever | work=NP 196 | publisher=Nintendo Power | date=[[2005]] | accessdate=2007-08-04}}</ref> and as the worst video game adaptation of a comic book by [[GameSpy]] in 2004 and by [[GameDaily]] in 2009.<ref name="GameSpy">Chapman, David (July 18, 2004). [http://www.gamespy.com/articles/530/530950p1.html Comics to Consoles: Part II - When Good Comics Go Bad]. [[GameSpy]]. Retrieved on May 25, 2008.</ref><ref name="GameDaily">[http://www.gamedaily.com/articles/galleries/top-25-worst-comic-book-video-games/?page=26 Worst Comic Book Adaptations]. Retried on March 13, 2009.</ref>
==2000s== ===''[[Aquaman: Battle for Atlantis]]'' (GameCube, Xbox)=== {{expand section|date=November 2011}} <!-- more sources -->
This 2003 action-adventure game by [[Lucky Chicken Games]] has a [[Metacritic]] score of 27/100 for its [[GameCube]] version and 26/100 for its [[Xbox]] version.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/games/platforms/xbx/aquamanbattleforatlantis |title=Aquaman: Battle for Atlantis for Xbox |accessdate=2011-03-21}}{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/gamecube/aquaman-battle-for-atlantis |title=Aquaman: Battle for Atlantis for GameCube |accessdate=2011-03-21}}</ref> Named as one of the worst games of all time by ''[[X-Play]]'', it was the inspiration for their annual award for the worst game of the year, "The Golden Mullet", a reference to the hairstyle Aquaman features in the game.<ref name="X-Play">[http://www.g4tv.com/xplay/videos/10864/Classic_XPlay_Aquaman_Review.html Classic X-Play: Aquaman Review]. [[G4 (TV channel)|G4]]. Retrieved on May 25, 2008.</ref> Similarly, the 2003 [[Nintendo Power Awards]] had an ironic category that was made only to give credit to Aquaman and "his sweet [[Mullet (haircut)|mullet]]".
===''[[Big Rigs: Over the Road Racing]]'' (PC)=== Released in a seemingly incomplete and buggy state, this 2004 racing game by [[Stellar Stone]] became infamous for its complete lack of [[collision detection]], entirely non-existent AI (as the computer opponent does not move, or otherwise participate in the "race" at all), extremely abnormal physics, and its victory screen{{emdash}}an image of a tri-handled trophy accompanied by the [[typo]]ed caption "YOU'RE WINNER !".<ref name="GSOver"/> In 2004, ''Big Rigs'' was listed as one of the worst games ever made by [[GameSpot]].<ref name="GSOver">Navarro, Alex (January 14, 2004) [http://www.gamespot.com/pc/driving/bigrigsotrr/review.html Big Rigs: Over the Road Racing for PC Review]. [[GameSpot]]. Retrieved on May 25, 2008.</ref> and [[Thunderbolt (website)|Thunderbolt]].<ref name="Thunder">Wadleigh, Matt (March 22, 2004). [http://www.thunderboltgames.com/reviews/viewreview.php?rid=381 Big Rigs: Over the Road Racing - PC review]. [[Thunderbolt (website)|Thunderbolt]]. Retrieved on May 25, 2008.</ref> The GameSpot review of ''Big Rigs'' called it "as bad as your mind allows you to comprehend", <ref name="GSOver">Navarro, Alex (January 14, 2004)</ref> and the video review contained no narration whatsoever, consisting of in-game footage interspersed with wider [[Shot (filmmaking)|shots]] showing the reviewer staring in disbelief, crying, and beating his head on a desk.<ref name="GSOver">[http://www.gamespot.com/pc/driving/bigrigsotrr/video/6086530/big-rigs-over-the-road-racing-video-review?om_act=convert&om_clk=gssummary&tag=summary;watch-review]. [[GameSpot]]. Retrieved on April 26, 2009.</ref> GameSpot also awarded it its annual Flat-Out Worst Game award for 2004, with its "trophy" being the three-handled "YOU'RE WINNER" trophy from the game itself.<ref name="gs-flatout2004">[http://www.gamespot.com/gamespot/features/all/bestof2004/day3w_12.html GameSpot's Best and Worst of 2004: Flat-Out Worst Game]. [[GameSpot]]. Retrieved on July 11, 2008.</ref> After declaring it the "worst game ever made" in a Games You Should Never Buy, ''[[X-Play]]''<nowiki></nowiki>'s [[Morgan Webb]] refused to even rate ''Big Rigs'' as their scale only went from 1 to 5.<ref name="X-Play">{{cite web|last=Satterfield|first=Shane|url=http://www.g4tv.com/xplay/features/484/Games_You_Should_Never_Buy.html|title=Games You Should Never Buy|publisher=[[X-Play]]|date=2004-03-23|accessdate=2009-05-31|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20050406001445/http://www.g4tv.com/xplay/features/484/Games_You_Should_Never_Buy.html|archivedate=2005-04-06}}</ref> ''Big Rigs'' was also named as the second Worst Video Game of the Decade at the 2009 SAGY Awards by ''[[ScrewAttack]]'' (losing to the 2006 ''[[Sonic the Hedgehog (2006 video game)|Sonic the Hedgehog]]'').<ref name="SA">{{cite web|url=http://screwattack.com/videos/SAGY-Awards-2009-Worst-Game-of-the-Decade-Winner |title=SAGY Awards 2009 Worst Game of the Decade Winner | ScrewAttack - Metal Gear Ben Finale LATER TODAY! |publisher=ScrewAttack |date= |accessdate=2010-05-14}}</ref> As of 2011, it has the lowest aggregate score of any video game on [[MetaCritic]] (8/100)<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/games/platforms/pc/bigrigsovertheroadracing |title=Big Rigs: Over the Road Racing for PC |accessdate=2011-03-21 |work=[[Metacritic]]}}</ref> and[[GameRankings]] (3.83%).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gamerankings.com/htmlpages2/919220.asp |title=Big Rigs: Over the Road Racing |work=[[GameRankings]] |accessdate=2011-03-21}}{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/browse.html?numrev=2&sort=1 |title=All-Time Worst |publisher=Gamerankings.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-21}}</ref> Due to the negative response by critics to the game however, ''Big Rigs'' gained a [[cult following]] and managed to sell well.{{citation needed|date=December 2011}}
===''[[Charlie's Angels (video game)|Charlie's Angels]]'' (PS2, GameCube)=== This 2003 third-person action game by [[Neko Entertainment]] has a [[Metacritic]] score of 23/100,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/games/platforms/cube/charliesangels |title=Charlie's Angels for GameCube |accessdate=2011-03-21}}</ref> and a [[GameRankings]] score of 24.57%, the lowest aggregate score of any video game with more than 20 featured reviews {{as of|2011|March}}.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/htmlpages2/542019.asp |title=Charlie's Angels for GameCube |publisher=GameRankings |date= |accessdate=2011-03-21}}{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/browse.html?sort=1 |title=All-Time Worst |publisher=Gamerankings.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-21}}</ref> [[GameSpot]] review called it a "horrific display of ineptitude."<ref>[http://www.gamespot.com/gamecube/action/charliesangels/review.html Charlie's Angels for GameCube Review - GameCube Charlie's Angels Review]. [[GameSpot]]. Retrieved July 11, 2008.</ref> The game was ranked #1 on [[GameTrailers]]' 2007 list of the Top 10 Worst Movie Games of all time, with a comment: "The game is degrading, not to women, not even to video games, but to humanity itself".<ref name="gametrailers.com"/>
===''[[Elf Bowling|Elf Bowling 1 & 2]]'' (NDS)=== This 2010 bowling game by NStorm has [[Metacritic]] score of 12/100, the second-lowest aggregate score of any video game on this website,<ref name="elfmetacrit">{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/games/platforms/ds/elfbowling1and2 |title=Elf Bowling 1 & 2 for DS |accessdate=2011-03-21 |work=[[Metacritic]]}}</ref> and a [[GameRankings]] score of 12.25%.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/ds/930384-elf-bowling-1-and-2/index.html|title=Elf Bowling 1 & 2|work=[[GameRankings]]|accessdate= 2010-04-25}}</ref> [[GameSpot]] rated the title 1.4/10, the lowest rating given for a [[Nintendo DS]] game, citing the fact that the games included are available for free on [[the Internet]], and criticizing the game's simplistic mechanics and visuals.<ref name="elfgamespot">{{cite web|url=http://uk.gamespot.com/ds/sports/elfbowling/review.html |title=Elf Bowling 1 & 2 Review for DS - GameSpot |accessdate=2010-04-25 |last=Provo |first=Frank |date=2006-01-03 |work=[[Gamespot]] }}</ref> [[IGN]] gave it a 1.0/10, calling it "absolutely retarded".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ds.ign.com/articles/675/675678p1.html|title=Elf Bowling 1 & 2 Review|work=[[IGN]]|accessdate= 2010-04-25}}</ref>
===''[[Leisure Suit Larry: Box Office Bust]]'' (PC, PS3, X360)=== This 2009 adventure game by [[Team17]] has a [[Metacritic]] score of 20/100 for its PC version, 17/100 for its PlayStation 3 version and 25/100 for its Xbox 360 version.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/leisure-suit-larry-box-office-bust |title=Leisure Suit Larry: Box Office Bust for PC |work=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=2011-03-21}}{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-3/leisure-suit-larry-box-office-bust |title=Leisure Suit Larry: Box Office Bust for Playstation 3 |work=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=2011-03-21}}{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-360/leisure-suit-larry-box-office-bust |title=Leisure Suit Larry: Box Office Bust for Xbox 360 |work=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=2011-03-21}}</ref> IGN gave it a 2.2/10, categorizing it as "painful", with a comment: "the lowest rating numbers here at IGN are reserved for games with nearly no redeeming qualities or interesting ideas, with next to nothing enjoyable to offer players, and which under no circumstances should be purchased by anyone. Leisure Suit Larry: Box Office Bust is, without a doubt, one of those games."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://xbox360.ign.com/articles/970/970747p1.html |title=Leisure Suit Larry: Box Office Bust Review |publisher=ign.com |date=2009-04-07 |accessdate=2010-06-16}}</ref> [[GameCentral]]'s review summarized the game as "one of the worst video games ever madeâbrutally unfunny and monotonously inept on every level."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.teletext.co.uk/gamecentral/features-reviews/d9a82753b047b21c49cad0a53eed1729/Leisure+Suit+Larry+(360).aspx|title=Leisure Suit Larry (360) |publisher=Teletext | accessdate=2010-06-16}}</ref> [[GameTrailers]] rated the game a 2.3/10, as of 2011 the lowest score ever given on the site.<ref>{{cite web|author=Posted: Apr 24, 2009 |url=http://www.gametrailers.com/video/review-hd-lsl-box/48468 |title=Leisure Suit Larry: Box Office Bust Video Game, Review HD | Video Clip | Game Trailers & Videos |publisher=GameTrailers.com |date=2009-04-24 |accessdate=2011-03-05}}</ref> It won several awards for the worst game of the year, including a SAGY award for the Worst Multiconsole game by [[Screwattack.com]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://screwattack.com/videos/Leisure-Suit-Lary-Box-Office-Bust-makes-me-throw-up |title=Leisure Suit Lary (Box Office Bust) makes me throw up! |author=Farmhouse |work=ScrewAttack.com |date=2010-04-20 |accessdate=2011-03-21}}</ref> the game the Worst Game of the Year Award by [[Giant Bomb]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.giantbomb.com/profile/jimbo_n/game-of-the-year-awards-2009-part-4-special-awards-part-2/30-35343/ |title=Game of the year awards 2009: Part 4 - Special awards, part 2 |author=Jimbo_N |work=Giant Bomb |date=2009-12-08 |accessdate=2011-03-21}}</ref> and the Worst Game of 2009 by ''[[Good Game]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.abc.net.au/tv/goodgame/stories/s2771397.htm |title=GG Awards 2009: Worst Game |date=2009-12-14 | accessdate=2011-03-21 |work=[[Good Game]]}}</ref> [[Al Lowe]], creator of the [[Leisure Suit Larry]] franchise, thanked VU Games on his website for keeping him away from what he called "the latest disaster".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.allowe.com/Larry/BOB.htm |title=Leisure Suit Larry: Box Office Bust |publisher=allowe.com | accessdate=2010-06-16}}</ref>
